dataIdInfo.envirDesc: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.2.2.3552

overview.eaover: UNITID = IPEDS Unique Identifier INSTNM = Institution Name ADDR = Address CITY = City Name STABBR = State Abbreviation ZIP = Zip Code FIPS = State FIPS Code COUNTYNM - County Name LONGITUD = Longitudinal Coordinates LATITUDE = Latitudinal Coordinates EFYTOTLT - Total Enrollment - Head Count

citeinfo.title: Enrollment in a Postsecondary Educational Institution, 2013

descript.abstract: Number of students enrolled in an award / degree program at a postsecondary Educational Institution in the 7-county Twin Cities metropolitan area of Minneapolis and Saint Paul. The data is from the U.S. Department of Education, Institute of Education Sciences, National Center for Education Statistics, Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System (IPEDS).
descript.purpose: Since Educational Institutions generate trips beyond those measured by employee counts as students regularly travel to campuses to attend class and that students attending Educational Institutions travel on the regional and local transportation infrastructure, including roads, transit, bicycle routes, trails and sidewalks, understanding where these Educational Institutions exist and the general level of enrollment is can help local planning understand the potential impact these trips may have on the transportation system.

timeperd.current: U.S. Department of Education, Institute of Education Sciences, National Center for Education Statistics, Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System (IPEDS).

theme.themekey: education, postsecondary, post secondary, IPEDS, enrollment

place.placekey: Twin Cities, Anoka County, Carver County, Dakota County, Hennepin County, Ramsey County, Scott County, Washington County

distinfo.distliab: NOTICE: The Geographic Information System (GIS) Data to which this notice is attached are made available pursuant to the Minnesota Government Data Practices Act (Minnesota Statutes Chapter 13). THE GIS DATA ARE PROVIDED TO YOU AS IS AND WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY AS TO THEIR PERFORMANCE, MERCHANTABILITY, OR FITNESS FOR ANY PARTICULAR PURPOSE. The GIS Data were developed by the Metropolitan Council for its own internal business purposes. The Metropolitan Council does not represent or warrant that the GIS Data or the data documentation are error-free, complete, current, or accurate. You are responsible for any consequences resulting from your use of the GIS Data or your reliance on the GIS Data. You should consult the data documentation for this particular GIS Data to determine the limitations of the GIS Data and the precision with which the GIS Data may depict distance, direction, location, or other geographic features. If you transmit or provide the GIS Data (or any portion of it) to another user, it is recommended that the GIS Data include a copy of this disclaimer and this metadata.

dataqual.complete: Complete based on institutional reporting to IPEDS

horizpa.horizpar: Point locations based on latitude and longitude records in IPEDS with the exception of Hennepin Technical College and University of Minnesota-Twin Cities. Both institutions have multiple campuses yet all completers were reported to a single location. Hennepin Tech. College - Eden Prairie and Univ. of Minnesota - St. Paul campuses were manually added to the database.

lineage.procstep:
Since Educational Institutions generate trips beyond those measured by employee counts as students regularly travel to campuses to attend class and that students attending Educational Institutions travel on the regional and local transportation infrastructure, including roads, transit, bicycle routes, trails and sidewalks, understanding where these Educational Institutions exist and the general level of enrollment is can help local planning understand the potential impact these trips may have on the transportation system.
Educational Institution locations and enrollment numbers are from the U.S. Department of Education, Institute of Education Sciences, National Center for Education Statistics, Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System (IPEDS) - http://nces.ed.gov/ipeds/datacenter/DataFiles.aspx. Two exceptions exist: Hennepin Technical College-Eden Prairie campus and University of Minnesota-Twin Cities-St Paul campus. These locations did not exist in the IPEDS database and were manually added to the GIS layer. All enrollment numbers for Hennepin Technical College and the University of Minnesota-Twin Cities institutions were attributed to the Hennepin Technical College-Brooklyn Park campus and the University of Minnesota-Twin Cities-Minneapolis campus, respectively. The enrollment for the individual Hennepin Technical College campuses are from the Director of Institutional Research at Hennepin Technical College. Some enrollment is atributed to off campus locations. The enrollment for the University of Minnesota-Twn Cities-St Paul campus is based on college enrollment published by the University (http://www.oir.umn.edu/student).Since Educational Institutions generate trips beyond those measured by employee counts as students regularly travel to campuses to attend class and that students attending Educational Institutions travel on the regional and local transportation infrastructure, including roads, transit, bicycle routes, trails and sidewalks, understanding where these Educational Institutions exist and the general level of enrollment is can help local planning understand the potential impact these trips may have on the transportation system.
Educational Institution locations and enrollment numbers are from the U.S. Department of Education, Institute of Education Sciences, National Center for Education Statistics, Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System (IPEDS) - http://nces.ed.gov/ipeds/datacenter/DataFiles.aspx
Two exceptions exist: Hennepin Technical College-Eden Prairie campus and University of Minnesota-Twin Cities-St Paul campus. These locations did not exist in the IPEDS database and were manually added to the GIS layer. All enrollment numbers for Hennepin Technical College and the University of Minnesota-Twin Cities institutions were attributed to the Hennepin Technical College-Brooklyn Park campus and the University of Minnesota-Twin Cities-Minneapolis campus, respectively. The enrollment for the individual Hennepin Technical College campuses are from the Director of Institutional Research at Hennepin Technical College. Some enrollment is atributed to off campus locations. The enrollment for the University of Minnesota-Twn Cities-St Paul campus is based on college enrollment published by the University http://www.oir.umn.edu/student/ Since Educational Institutions generate trips beyond those measured by employee counts as students regularly travel to campuses to attend class and that students attending Educational Institutions travel on the regional and local transportation infrastructure, including roads, transit, bicycle routes, trails and sidewalks, understanding where these Educational Institutions exist and the general level of enrollment is can help local planning understand the potential impact these trips may have on the transportation system.
Educational Institution locations and enrollment numbers are from the U.S. Department of Education, Institute of Education Sciences, National Center for Education Statistics, Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System (IPEDS) - http://nces.ed.gov/ipeds/datacenter/DataFiles.aspx
Two exceptions exist: Hennepin Technical College-Eden Prairie campus and University of Minnesota-Twin Cities-St Paul campus. These locations did not exist in the IPEDS database and were manually added to the GIS layer. All enrollment numbers for Hennepin Technical College and the University of Minnesota-Twin Cities institutions were attributed to the Hennepin Technical College-Brooklyn Park campus and the University of Minnesota-Twin Cities-Minneapolis campus, respectively. The enrollment for the individual Hennepin Technical College campuses are from the Director of Institutional Research at Hennepin Technical College. Some enrollment is atributed to off campus locations. The enrollment for the University of Minnesota-Twn Cities-St Paul campus is based on college enrollment published by the University http://www.oir.umn.edu/student/
